Detailed Description

The common module holds various data structures, algorithms and constants that are shared by many modules.

UPPER_LEFT_ARM 

Upper left arm, shoulder to elbow.

enum ConnectionState::ConnectionStateEnum

public Enum representing all the different connection states.

Enumerator:
LISTENING 

Listening for incoming connections, ie waiting for a peer to connect.

ESTABLISHING 

Establishing the connection, in this state the players are trading information such as usernames.

CONNECTED 

Connected to the peer.

DISCONNECTED 

Not connected to anyone.

enum GameState::GameStateEnum

public Enum representing all the different game states.

Enumerator:
NOT_RUNNING 

The game is not currently running.

PAUSED 

The game is paused.

RUNNING 

The game is running.

enum Player::PlayerEnum

public Enum representing all the different players.

Enumerator:
LOCAL 

The local player.

PEER 

The remote player.

Variable Documentation

const float World::error_margin = 0.001f [static]

public Error margin for floating point comparisons.

We need this to make sure that an object on the edge of a box is considered within the box. For example, if a coordinate has x = 5.0 and a box has min_x = 3.0 and max_x = 5.0 then the coordinate Is not considered inside of the box so we need "min_x = 3.0 - error_margin" and "max_x = 5.0 + error_margin"

const cVector3d World::local_avatar_starting_position = cVector3d(0.0f, 0.0f, 6.0f) [static]

public Our avatar's starting position.

const cCollisionAABBBox World::local_ball_bounding_box [static]
Initial value:
 cCollisionAABBBox(
        cVector3d(-0.3f - error_margin, 0.0f - error_margin, 5.0f - error_margin), 
        cVector3d(0.3f + error_margin, 0.5f + error_margin, 6.0f + error_margin))

public Local ball bounding box.

        cVector3d(0.3f + error_margin, 0.5f + error_margin, -6.0f + error_margin))
